story:
Mikme Silver Microphone

Now available at Indiegogo starting at $199

Please go to Mikme Silver page!

 

 

 

 World's First
Wireless Recording Microphone

 

 

 

 

With Mikme,nothing will stop
your creative flow.

 

 

 

Mikme is the world’s first fully wireless recording microphone that captures your audio at the push of a button. Equipped with a gold-plated condenser capsule, you’ll get nothing short of studio-grade sound.

 

Just tap Mikme, start recording on its built-in audio recorder, then send your music—via Bluetooth—to the Mikme mobile app for editing, tweaking, adjusting and sharing.

And it looks great, too!

 

 

What the Press Says

 

Mikme is a wireless microphone and audio recorder like no other
by Devindra Hardawar - Engadget

 

"...it could be incredibly useful to musicians who want to record their work on the go, or for journalists and podcasters who need something more capable than their iPhone's microphone."

 

 

 

 

Is Mikme the GoPro of Microphones?
by Joel Johnson - Fast Company

"The secret to great video is audio. In an age where your cameraphone shoots video that isn't just good enough, but actually pretty great, the tinny, flat sound that accompanies most videos remains the starkest difference between amateur and pro. Where's the GoPro or iPhone for audio?

Well, it might be Mikme."

Mikme microphone promises studio quality sound in a tiny package
by Derek Walter - Macworld

 

 

​"...when Mikme played back a variety of recordings, ranging from interviews to music, I was impressed.​"​

 

Mikme’s Tiny Wireless Microphone Could Change Our Expectations for Quality Audio Anywhere
by Jaron Schneider - Resource Magazine
"Audio can be baffling, challenging and expensive. If you aren’t sure what you’re doing, you end up with sound that is akin to hearing a conversation through a tin can in a Miami club. “Good” audio equipment is expensive and doesn’t guarantee results. Well, that was the case until Mikme. I spent some time with the attractive little box and its creator, Philipp Sonnleitner, and have seen (or rather, heard) what it is capable of… and I was impressed.​"​
 

What Musicians Say



 

 

 

Capture Every Detail
from Every Sound

 

 

 

 

 

Whether you're a musician. filmmaker, podcaster, student, skyper or lover of sound, Mikme is designed to capture it all.

Great for songwriting, composing, interviews, sampling, rehearsals, skyping, video, multi-track audio and more. If there's a sound you want to capture, Mikme's got your back.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

How's Mikme Sound?
Give It a Listen.

 

 

PLEASE USE HEADPHONES FOR LISTENING TO THE VIDEO!
This is an audio recording made with iPhone 6 and Mikme Microphone. We are switching between iPhone 6 internal microphone and the Mikme Microphone back and forth. Video was shot on an iPhone 6.
 

These are unedited samples recorded with Mikme.

Click to listen to more samples!

 

 

 

 

What Makes Mikme Better?

 

The Mikme Microphone is a very versatile tool. It works wirelessly with your smartphone, tablet or computer by streaming audio securely and immediately while recording. It also works standalone with it's builtin digital 16GB audio recorder (24 bit, up to 96kHz). And with it's large 1 inch true condenser, gold plated capsule it outperforms all USB and digital audio recorder in the market.

 

One-Button Audio Recording

 

 

Press a single button and start creating. No cables, no interface, no confusion. Builtin-audio recorder for recording up to 360 hours of audio.

360 Hours of Audio

 

 

 

Its built-in flash drive (16 GB) will store up to 360 hours or raw audio (24 bit, up to 96 kHz). No other device needed. Works completely standalone.

Totally Wireless

With the Mikme Mobile App, you can create, edit, mix and share without using a single wire. It's all done using the latest Bluetooth technology.

Mikme's patent pending wireless link based on top of the latest Bluetooth technology, streams audio securely and immediately to your smartphone, tablet or computer while recording.

 

Studio-Grade Sound

 

Made with a 1 inch gold-plated condenser capsule, Mikme features a 24 Bit audio resolution with a sampling frequency of up to 96 kHz (the audio geeks know what this means).

Built-In Soundcheck

 

 

 
To get the best sound, sometimes you have to adjust the gain. Thankfully, Mikme does it for you. Press one button, perform for 7 seconds and Mikme will setup the gain right for you.
 

Edit On the Fly

 

Mikme comes with free iPhone (iOS 9+ ready) and Android (coming autumn) apps, that gives you total control of your sound. Mix up to 8 tracks, add effects, share with the world.

With our wireless link you can wirelessly record studio-quality audio from your Mikme microphone into your smartphone or tablet.

The iOS version of the Mikme app is already available at the Apple App store for free right now.

 

Get the free Mikme Audio Recording App

 

 

 

 

 

HD Videos with Studio Sound

 

 

 

 

With the Mikme app you can also make stuning videos and get crystal clear studio-quality sound wirelessly from your Mikme Microphone. The app with our patent pending 'Lost & Found' protocol will make sure that video and audio are in perfect sync.

Simple, Elegant and Beautiful

 

 

 

 

Intricately crafted with high-quality materials, both inside and out, Mikme looks as great as it captures sound. It's metal frame makes it sturdy for your mobile recordings. And by manufacturing in Munich, Germany we can guarantee the highest possible quality.
 

Freedom to Record

 
 
Mikme gives you loads of options for capturing your sound. Record standalone up to 370 hours of audio or plug in via USB with up to 96kHz using your smartphone, tablet or computer. You can even control and record from up to 3 Mikme microphones from a single mobile phone (with a future update of the app). Directly monitor your audio via headphones or connect your DSLR camera with a minijack cable.
Mikme is a full-on mobile recording studio. Literally!
 

 

Style meets Sound

 

 

 

Now available with any Mikme order are all-metal microphone stands. Made by Austrian fashion designer AND_i, known for his work with Lady Gaga, Bentley, Swarovski and Absolut Vodka, the stands help bring Mikme closer to your performance, and they look good in the process. Available in three styles and four colors, all stands can be added to any order. And if you’re looking for even more flair, a stylish floor stand is also available—we hope you have the style to pull it off though!

 

 

 

• Desk Stand: $49 (Colors - Silver, Black, Gold, Blue)

• Tall Desk Stand: $59 (Colors - Silver, Black, Gold, Blue)

• SciFi Desk Stand: $79 (with laser engraved serial number)

• Leather Bag with integrated Windscreen: $79

• Crown & Necklace: $600 (Colors - Black, Gold)

• Floor Stand: $1200 (Color - Silver)

 

Keep Mikme Safe On Your Travels

 

 

 

 

 

Mikme was designed to record on the go. But it wasn’t made to be tossed every which way with impunity. To help keep your gear safe, we’ve designed all-leather carrying bag with an integrated windscreen (Designed by Austrian fashion designer NORArieser). So you can record on the go with Mikme within the bag and block unwanted wind noise. These can also be added to any order for only $79. Happy recording!

 

Pricing is as follows:

• Leather Bag with integrated Windscreen: $79

 

 

Check Out the Specs

 

 

 

Audio
1 x Capsule – 1 inch, gold plated, true condenser
Polar pattern – Cardioid
Audio frequency bandwidth – 18 to 22000 Hz
Sensitivity – 18 mV/Pa
Signal to noise – 78 dB-A
Maximum Sound Pressure Level – 130dB
Adjustable Microphone Gain – 0 to -30 dB

Internal Audio Recorder
Internal memory – 16 GB
Recording time –  up to 370+ hours MP4 or 34+ hours WAV
Bit depth – 24
Sampling frequencies – 44.1 kHz, 48 kHz, 96 kHz
Processor – 2x168 MHz Cortex M4
Rechargeable Li-Po battery – 920 mAh
Battery-powered operation time standalone recording – 3.5 hours

Bluetooth
Bluetooth 2.1
Battery-powered operation time with bluetooth recording – 3.5 hours

 

Wireless – Bluetooth Mikme Lost & Found Protocol
Immediate Secure Audio Transmission with patent pending Packet Loss and Sync Detection = Quality of Service Audio Streaming with Mikme app

Works with
64 Bit Devices with iOS 9 and newer (with installed MIKME app)
Check here if your device is compatible: http://blakespot.com/ios_device_specifications_...
Devices with Android 7.0 (Nougat) and newer (with installed MIKME app) - later in 2017 available

 

 

Wired – Micro USB Connector

Works with
Windows XP and higher with USB 2.0
Mac OS 10.8 and higher with USB 2.0
iOS 9 and newer
Android 7.0 (Nougat) and newer

Audio Out 3.5mm Mini Jack
Low latency monitoring of
- Microphone capsule audio signal
- Playback audio signal from Mikme App
- Mix balance adjustable via Mikme App

Used for
- Headphones Monitoring
- Stereo audio out to DSLR or mixer

Mounting
3/8 in thread for microphone stands
1/4 in thread for DSLR tripods and mic stands

Dimensions and Weight
70 mm (2.75 in) x 70 mm (2.75 in) x 35 mm (1.4 in)
250 g (0.4 lbs) Weight

 

 

 

 


Meet Mikme's Creator, Phillip

 

 

 

Philipp Sonnleitner founded Mikme so that content creators such as artists, video makers and podcasters could focus on making music, videos and recording audio wherever they are.

As a creative and musician, Philipp was frustrated by how long it took him to record a new idea or song. Setting up microphones in front of his acoustic piano, connecting cables, setting up sound cards and recording software simply took too long.

Before leaving his job to make Mikme, Philipp was a software engineer and product manager at AKG—the legendary Austrian microphone and headphone manufacturer— for 8 years.

 

 

 

Meet the Team

 

 

 

 

Together, with Josef Scheider (Former head of mechanical design at AKG for 20+ years), Alex Pohl (Lead designer), Richard Pribyl (former lead acoustic engineer at AKG for 35+ years) and Manuel Gattinger (Industrial designer) we brought this project to life.

Mikme consists of a passionate team of 15 designers, musicians and engineers who  brought more than 150 successful, world-class audio products to market. Such as studio  microphones and studio/consumer headphones, wireless microphones and Bluetooth speakers for companies such as AKG, JBL, Samsung, Audi, BMW and others.

In sum we hold 80+ patents and won 40+ design awards. 

Design and engineering takes place in Austria, Germany, Netherlands, Serbia and the USA. Mikme will be manufactured in Germany.

 

Please contact us if you have feedback, ideas or anything else that could make Mikme even better: hello@mikme.com

Thank you!

 

 

 

 

 

Why We Need Your Help

 

 

 

 

We have working prototypes which are recording crystal clear audio and are transmitting audio securely and reliable through our Mikme Lost & Found wireless link.

The free Mikme App is available on the Apple App store already. It works standalone using the iPhone's internal microphone and other external microphones. So you can try it already and see what we are building.

Now to get manufacturing done we need your help. We need at least $25.000 to get a minimum order quantity to order the first pieces of Mikme from our contract manufacturer from Munich, Germany.

Support Mikme at Indiegogo and soon you'll be able to record audio with one button in studio-quality.

 

From Conception to Creation

 

2013
October – Project Start
December – Basic Concept

2014
January – Basic App UI
March – Industrial design
March – User interaction
May – Rough design prototype 
June – Mechanical construction
August – Electronics ready
November – 1st working prototype
December – MIKME App 1.0 release 

2015
January – MIKME App 1.1 release (added import, export, sharing)
March – Wireless link running on 1st prototype
April – MIKME App 1.2 release (added effects)
May – 3rd generation prototype (25 pieces)
June – Indiegogo Campaign launched
August – Tools ordered and original capsule supplier backed out
September – New capsule manufacturer selected
October – Reengineering of Mikme electronics and capsule holder
November – New prototypes available with new capsule
December – Pre-trial run production

2016
January – New capsule holders out of toolings
June – Trial run I production
August – Trial run II production
September – Mass production starts
November – Shipping to first Indiegogo contributors start

2017
June – Worldwide Launch

 

Risks and Challenges

 

Well, if there weren’t a risk we wouldn't be on Indiegogo.

We are a team of very experienced individuals who have gone through the product development process more than once (our team designed, developed and manufactured more than 150 products). Unforeseen things sometimes happen, but we are convinced that we can start manufacturing the first series in August/September 2016.

The biggest risk eliminator is the minimum-order-quantity. This is why we need funding of more than $25.000. Every additional cent makes it safer. We have already a contract manufacturer in Munich, Germany. Again, quantity is very important.

Once produced, we will stamp "Made in Germany" on each box, which reinforces constant production quality.

 

 

 

FAQ

 

  • [App] - Will the app be available for Android too?
    Yes. We will offer a Mikme recording app for Android too. The Android version will be available at public launch of Mikme. The iOS Mikme App is already available on the Apple App store.
    Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now!
     

  • [App] - Will the app work on an iPad just as well?
    Yes. The iOS app will also work on an iPad.
    Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now!
     
  • [App] - Will there be an export function to export the separate tracks as audio files (WAV, AIFF, etc.) for further editing in third party program on a Mac or a pc?
    Yes. You are already able to export all tracks of a song as individual files, and an entire mixdown of the song. These tracks can then be imported on a Mac or PC. The files can either be exported via Mail, Dropbox or iTunes file sharing.
    You can also share the entire open song with all settings and separate tracks to other Mikme App users for further editing or recordings. This makes collaboration extremely fast and easy.
    Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now!
     
  • [Sound] - Is it possible to adjust the gain level of the microphone? I often record in very loud environments!
    The Mikme Microphone has an adjustable gain of 0-30dB. It can handle even the loudest signals. For setting up the gain easily we have implemented Sound Check. Simply tap and hold the capture button for a second, then perform for seven seconds. Your Mikme Microphone will automatically adjust the gain on its own. Never dial in your gain on a rotary knob any longer.
     
  • [Sound] - Can Mikme handle high SPL signals?
    Mikme has a 30db built in adjustable gain and can handle up to 145db SPL (Sound pressure level). So even loud guitar amps and bass drums should be no problem.
     
  • [Skype] - Does the Mikme microphone work for Skype calls?
    Yes. If you make Skype calls on your Computer (Windows or MacOS) or Mobile device (iOS or Android) you connect wired via USB to your device and you can call in high audio quality.
     

  • [GoPro] - Does Mikme work with my GoPro Camera?
    Yes. Mikme will work with your GoPro camera. You can connect the headphone out mini jack of the Mikme microphone with a minijack cable with the microphone input of the GoPro. The Mikme microphone will send the high quality sound of it's capsule directly to the headphone output with no latency. You can adjust the volume out of the headphone out directly on the Mikme microphone so you can find the right volume to match the GoPro input.
    Further more you can record locally at the Mikme microphone if you move around with the GoPro and want the microphone to stay let's say at a table or somewhere else. This gives you additional freedom.

     

     

    • [Bluetooth] - What is the Bluetooth wireless range, maximum distance?
      That mainly depends of the location you are using Mikme. Normally between 10-15 meters.  Inside buildings and depending on the room you are using Mikme in it can be longer.
       
    • [Bluetooth] - What is the latency in live recordings?
      Normally the latency is around 30-100ms. That depends on how much Mikme microphone are connected. The audio monitoring is done right at the Mikme with headphones so you have no latency in monitoring yourself through Mikme Microphone. Also playback tracks from the Mikme App can be monitored on the Mikme microphone itself.
  • [Bluetooth] - Is Bluetooth used to sync audio recording to iOS devices in real time or is it only used to sync multiple recorders to work together?
    Both assumptions are right. We are using bluetooth to first make sure the audio is sent in realtime to the phone. We have our own patented Lost & Found protocol on top of bluetooth so you can be sure not a single piece of audio is lost. This works for multiple Mikmes too. Furthermore we sync and remote control via bluetooth and other mechanisms. So that all audio streams are perfectly in sync at your app.
     
  • [Bluetooth] - So the audio is compressed, because 96k/24bits is 2304kbps which is beyond the capability of Bluetooth? Is it a lossless compression?
    96kHz can only be recorded locally. If you want to record wirelessly the sampling rate is switched to 44.1 kHz. The Mikme microphone is recording with with to 44.1 kHz/24bit and saves the raw wav files at its internal 16GB memory. At the same time we are encoding that file into a mp4 file with an aac encoder. This decreases the files size by roughly 10 times and that file is than streamed via bluetooth to the app. The app then process the mp4 files.
    We made quite a lot hearing tests with audio engineers, musicians and hifi guys to find out if that compression is good enough. We found out that the aac works really well and that it’s nearly impossible to distinguish between the original and compressed files. Most of the test persons, and these were audio pros, had no chance to tell the difference.
    If you still want to have the raw files you can transfer them from the mic via USB onto your computer for further processing.
     
  • [Other] - What's the housing made of?
    The top and the bottom parts are plastic (need to be plastic so we get the wireless bluetooth connection in and out). It's high quality plastic.
    The main middle part of the frame is out of metal.

"Audio can be baffling, challenging and expensive. If you aren’t sure what you’re doing, you end up with sound that is akin to hearing a conversation through a tin can in a Miami club. “Good” audio equipment is expensive and doesn’t guarantee results. Well, that was the case until Mikme. I spent some time with the attractive little box and its creator, Philipp Sonnleitner, and have seen (or rather, heard) what it is capable of… and I was impressed.​"​

 
What Musicians Say   
Capture Every Detailfrom Every Sound
 


 
 
 



 


Whether you're a musician. filmmaker, podcaster, student, skyper or lover of sound, Mikme is designed to capture it all.
Great for songwriting, composing, interviews, sampling, rehearsals, skyping, video, multi-track audio and more. If there's a sound you want to capture, Mikme's got your back.
 
 

 
    
How's Mikme Sound?Give It a Listen.
 
 
PLEASE USE HEADPHONES FOR LISTENING TO THE VIDEO!This is an audio recording made with iPhone 6 and Mikme Microphone. We are switching between iPhone 6 internal microphone and the Mikme Microphone back and forth. Video was shot on an iPhone 6. 

These are unedited samples recorded with Mikme.
Click to listen to more samples!
 
 

 
 
What Makes Mikme Better?
 

The Mikme Microphone is a very versatile tool. It works wirelessly with your smartphone, tablet or computer by streaming audio securely and immediately while recording. It also works standalone with it's builtin digital 16GB audio recorder (24 bit, up to 96kHz). And with it's large 1 inch true condenser, gold plated capsule it outperforms all USB and digital audio recorder in the market.
 
One-Button Audio Recording
 


 
Press a single button and start creating. No cables, no interface, no confusion. Builtin-audio recorder for recording up to 360 hours of audio.
360 Hours of Audio 
 
 Its built-in flash drive (16 GB) will store up to 360 hours or raw audio (24 bit, up to 96 kHz). No other device needed. Works completely standalone.
Totally Wireless

With the Mikme Mobile App, you can create, edit, mix and share without using a single wire. It's all done using the latest Bluetooth technology.
Mikme's patent pending wireless link based on top of the latest Bluetooth technology, streams audio securely and immediately to your smartphone, tablet or computer while recording.
 
Studio-Grade Sound
 

Made with a 1 inch gold-plated condenser capsule, Mikme features a 24 Bit audio resolution with a sampling frequency of up to 96 kHz (the audio geeks know what this means).Built-In Soundcheck 
 

 To get the best sound, sometimes you have to adjust the gain. Thankfully, Mikme does it for you. Press one button, perform for 7 seconds and Mikme will setup the gain right for you. Edit On the Fly 
Mikme comes with free iPhone (iOS 9+ ready) and Android (coming autumn) apps, that gives you total control of your sound. Mix up to 8 tracks, add effects, share with the world.
With our wireless link you can wirelessly record studio-quality audio from your Mikme microphone into your smartphone or tablet.
The iOS version of the Mikme app is already available at the Apple App store for free right now.
 
Get the free Mikme Audio Recording App
 
 

 
 
 
HD Videos with Studio Sound
 
 
 
 With the Mikme app you can also make stuning videos and get crystal clear studio-quality sound wirelessly from your Mikme Microphone. The app with our patent pending 'Lost & Found' protocol will make sure that video and audio are in perfect sync.
Simple, Elegant and Beautiful    Intricately crafted with high-quality materials, both inside and out, Mikme looks as great as it captures sound. It's metal frame makes it sturdy for your mobile recordings. And by manufacturing in Munich, Germany we can guarantee the highest possible quality. 
Freedom to Record
 
 Mikme gives you loads of options for capturing your sound. Record standalone up to 370 hours of audio or plug in via USB with up to 96kHz using your smartphone, tablet or computer. You can even control and record from up to 3 Mikme microphones from a single mobile phone (with a future update of the app). Directly monitor your audio via headphones or connect your DSLR camera with a minijack cable.Mikme is a full-on mobile recording studio. Literally! 
 

Style meets Sound
 



 
 
Now available with any Mikme order are all-metal microphone stands. Made by Austrian fashion designer AND_i, known for his work with Lady Gaga, Bentley, Swarovski and Absolut Vodka, the stands help bring Mikme closer to your performance, and they look good in the process. Available in three styles and four colors, all stands can be added to any order. And if you’re looking for even more flair, a stylish floor stand is also available—we hope you have the style to pull it off though!
 
  
• Desk Stand: $49 (Colors - Silver, Black, Gold, Blue)
• Tall Desk Stand: $59 (Colors - Silver, Black, Gold, Blue)
• SciFi Desk Stand: $79 (with laser engraved serial number)
• Leather Bag with integrated Windscreen: $79
• Crown & Necklace: $600 (Colors - Black, Gold)
• Floor Stand: $1200 (Color - Silver)
 
Keep Mikme Safe On Your Travels
 
 
 
  
Mikme was designed to record on the go. But it wasn’t made to be tossed every which way with impunity. To help keep your gear safe, we’ve designed all-leather carrying bag with an integrated windscreen (Designed by Austrian fashion designer NORArieser). So you can record on the go with Mikme within the bag and block unwanted wind noise. These can also be added to any order for only $79. Happy recording!
 
Pricing is as follows:
• Leather Bag with integrated Windscreen: $79  


Check Out the Specs  
 
Audio1 x Capsule – 1 inch, gold plated, true condenserPolar pattern – CardioidAudio frequency bandwidth – 18 to 22000 HzSensitivity – 18 mV/PaSignal to noise – 78 dB-AMaximum Sound Pressure Level – 130dBAdjustable Microphone Gain – 0 to -30 dB
Internal Audio RecorderInternal memory – 16 GBRecording time –  up to 370+ hours MP4 or 34+ hours WAVBit depth – 24Sampling frequencies – 44.1 kHz, 48 kHz, 96 kHzProcessor – 2x168 MHz Cortex M4Rechargeable Li-Po battery – 920 mAhBattery-powered operation time standalone recording – 3.5 hoursBluetoothBluetooth 2.1Battery-powered operation time with bluetooth recording – 3.5 hours Wireless – Bluetooth Mikme Lost & Found ProtocolImmediate Secure Audio Transmission with patent pending Packet Loss and Sync Detection = Quality of Service Audio Streaming with Mikme appWorks with64 Bit Devices with iOS 9 and newer (with installed MIKME app)Check here if your device is compatible: http://blakespot.com/ios_device_specifications_...Devices with Android 7.0 (Nougat) and newer (with installed MIKME app) - later in 2017 available  Wired – Micro USB ConnectorWorks withWindows XP and higher with USB 2.0Mac OS 10.8 and higher with USB 2.0iOS 9 and newerAndroid 7.0 (Nougat) and newerAudio Out 3.5mm Mini JackLow latency monitoring of- Microphone capsule audio signal- Playback audio signal from Mikme App- Mix balance adjustable via Mikme AppUsed for- Headphones Monitoring- Stereo audio out to DSLR or mixerMounting3/8 in thread for microphone stands1/4 in thread for DSLR tripods and mic standsDimensions and Weight70 mm (2.75 in) x 70 mm (2.75 in) x 35 mm (1.4 in)250 g (0.4 lbs) Weight    
Meet Mikme's Creator, Phillip   
Philipp Sonnleitner founded Mikme so that content creators such as artists, video makers and podcasters could focus on making music, videos and recording audio wherever they are.
As a creative and musician, Philipp was frustrated by how long it took him to record a new idea or song. Setting up microphones in front of his acoustic piano, connecting cables, setting up sound cards and recording software simply took too long.
Before leaving his job to make Mikme, Philipp was a software engineer and product manager at AKG—the legendary Austrian microphone and headphone manufacturer— for 8 years.
 
 
 
Meet the Team
 
   Together, with Josef Scheider (Former head of mechanical design at AKG for 20+ years), Alex Pohl (Lead designer), Richard Pribyl (former lead acoustic engineer at AKG for 35+ years) and Manuel Gattinger (Industrial designer) we brought this project to life.Mikme consists of a passionate team of 15 designers, musicians and engineers who  brought more than 150 successful, world-class audio products to market. Such as studio  microphones and studio/consumer headphones, wireless microphones and Bluetooth speakers for companies such as AKG, JBL, Samsung, Audi, BMW and others.In sum we hold 80+ patents and won 40+ design awards. Design and engineering takes place in Austria, Germany, Netherlands, Serbia and the USA. Mikme will be manufactured in Germany. Please contact us if you have feedback, ideas or anything else that could make Mikme even better: hello@mikme.comThank you!    
 
Why We Need Your Help
 
 
 
 We have working prototypes which are recording crystal clear audio and are transmitting audio securely and reliable through our Mikme Lost & Found wireless link.
The free Mikme App is available on the Apple App store already. It works standalone using the iPhone's internal microphone and other external microphones. So you can try it already and see what we are building.
Now to get manufacturing done we need your help. We need at least $25.000 to get a minimum order quantity to order the first pieces of Mikme from our contract manufacturer from Munich, Germany.
Support Mikme at Indiegogo and soon you'll be able to record audio with one button in studio-quality.
 

From Conception to Creation

 
2013October – Project StartDecember – Basic Concept2014January – Basic App UIMarch – Industrial designMarch – User interactionMay – Rough design prototype June – Mechanical constructionAugust – Electronics readyNovember – 1st working prototypeDecember – MIKME App 1.0 release 
2015January – MIKME App 1.1 release (added import, export, sharing)March – Wireless link running on 1st prototypeApril – MIKME App 1.2 release (added effects)May – 3rd generation prototype (25 pieces)June – Indiegogo Campaign launchedAugust – Tools ordered and original capsule supplier backed outSeptember – New capsule manufacturer selectedOctober – Reengineering of Mikme electronics and capsule holderNovember – New prototypes available with new capsuleDecember – Pre-trial run production
2016January – New capsule holders out of toolingsJune – Trial run I productionAugust – Trial run II productionSeptember – Mass production startsNovember – Shipping to first Indiegogo contributors start
2017June – Worldwide Launch

 
Risks and Challenges

 
Well, if there weren’t a risk we wouldn't be on Indiegogo.

We are a team of very experienced individuals who have gone through the product development process more than once (our team designed, developed and manufactured more than 150 products). Unforeseen things sometimes happen, but we are convinced that we can start manufacturing the first series in August/September 2016.
The biggest risk eliminator is the minimum-order-quantity. This is why we need funding of more than $25.000. Every additional cent makes it safer. We have already a contract manufacturer in Munich, Germany. Again, quantity is very important.
Once produced, we will stamp "Made in Germany" on each box, which reinforces constant production quality.
 
 
 
FAQ
 

[App] - Will the app be available for Android too?Yes. We will offer a Mikme recording app for Android too. The Android version will be available at public launch of Mikme. The iOS Mikme App is already available on the Apple App store.Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now! 

[App] - Will the app work on an iPad just as well?Yes. The iOS app will also work on an iPad.Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now! 

[App] - Will there be an export function to export the separate tracks as audio files (WAV, AIFF, etc.) for further editing in third party program on a Mac or a pc?Yes. You are already able to export all tracks of a song as individual files, and an entire mixdown of the song. These tracks can then be imported on a Mac or PC. The files can either be exported via Mail, Dropbox or iTunes file sharing.You can also share the entire open song with all settings and separate tracks to other Mikme App users for further editing or recordings. This makes collaboration extremely fast and easy.Get the Mikme Audio Recording App for iOS now! 

[Sound] - Is it possible to adjust the gain level of the microphone? I often record in very loud environments!The Mikme Microphone has an adjustable gain of 0-30dB. It can handle even the loudest signals. For setting up the gain easily we have implemented Sound Check. Simply tap and hold the capture button for a second, then perform for seven seconds. Your Mikme Microphone will automatically adjust the gain on its own. Never dial in your gain on a rotary knob any longer. 

[Sound] - Can Mikme handle high SPL signals?Mikme has a 30db built in adjustable gain and can handle up to 145db SPL (Sound pressure level). So even loud guitar amps and bass drums should be no problem. 

[Skype] - Does the Mikme microphone work for Skype calls?Yes. If you make Skype calls on your Computer (Windows or MacOS) or Mobile device (iOS or Android) you connect wired via USB to your device and you can call in high audio quality. 

[GoPro] - Does Mikme work with my GoPro Camera?Yes. Mikme will work with your GoPro camera. You can connect the headphone out mini jack of the Mikme microphone with a minijack cable with the microphone input of the GoPro. The Mikme microphone will send the high quality sound of it's capsule directly to the headphone output with no latency. You can adjust the volume out of the headphone out directly on the Mikme microphone so you can find the right volume to match the GoPro input.Further more you can record locally at the Mikme microphone if you move around with the GoPro and want the microphone to stay let's say at a table or somewhere else. This gives you additional freedom.
 
 

[Bluetooth] - What is the Bluetooth wireless range, maximum distance?That mainly depends of the location you are using Mikme. Normally between 10-15 meters.  Inside buildings and depending on the room you are using Mikme in it can be longer. 

[Bluetooth] - What is the latency in live recordings?Normally the latency is around 30-100ms. That depends on how much Mikme microphone are connected. The audio monitoring is done right at the Mikme with headphones so you have no latency in monitoring yourself through Mikme Microphone. Also playback tracks from the Mikme App can be monitored on the Mikme microphone itself.


[Bluetooth] - Is Bluetooth used to sync audio recording to iOS devices in real time or is it only used to sync multiple recorders to work together?Both assumptions are right. We are using bluetooth to first make sure the audio is sent in realtime to the phone. We have our own patented Lost & Found protocol on top of bluetooth so you can be sure not a single piece of audio is lost. This works for multiple Mikmes too. Furthermore we sync and remote control via bluetooth and other mechanisms. So that all audio streams are perfectly in sync at your app. 

[Bluetooth] - So the audio is compressed, because 96k/24bits is 2304kbps which is beyond the capability of Bluetooth? Is it a lossless compression?96kHz can only be recorded locally. If you want to record wirelessly the sampling rate is switched to 44.1 kHz. The Mikme microphone is recording with with to 44.1 kHz/24bit and saves the raw wav files at its internal 16GB memory. At the same time we are encoding that file into a mp4 file with an aac encoder. This decreases the files size by roughly 10 times and that file is than streamed via bluetooth to the app. The app then process the mp4 files.We made quite a lot hearing tests with audio engineers, musicians and hifi guys to find out if that compression is good enough. We found out that the aac works really well and that it’s nearly impossible to distinguish between the original and compressed files. Most of the test persons, and these were audio pros, had no chance to tell the difference.If you still want to have the raw files you can transfer them from the mic via USB onto your computer for further processing. 

[Other] - What's the housing made of?The top and the bottom parts are plastic (need to be plastic so we get the wireless bluetooth connection in and out). It's high quality plastic.The main middle part of the frame is out of metal.

story:
MUZE Charcoal Black

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Questions and answers

 

Does it really sound as good as you say it does?

Yes. You got to experience it for yourself. It will change the way you listen to music.

How much is MUZE expected to retail for?

$129 US

Does it run off batteries?

The power requirement to achieve this kind of performance requires MUZE  to be plugged in to a 100V to 230V wall outlet. This isn't your raspy Bluetooth speaker. This is a powerful game changer.

Will MUZE work with my particular phone/tablet/computer?

MUZE is compatible with most Bluetooth-enabled devices including Android phones/tablets, iOS devices like iPod touch, iPhone, iPad and most Mac or PC computers.

What is its wireless range?

Bluetooth has a range of 10 meters (33 feet) open air. Distance will vary with walls and your device’s capability.

Which phones are capable of wireless charging?

Phone compatible with QI Wireless charging as of June 2018:

  • Apple iPhone: 8, 8 Plus, X
  • Samsung Galaxy: S9, S9+, Note 8, S8, S8+, S7, S7 Edge, Note 5, S6, S6 Edge
  • LG: V30, G6 (US version only), G4 (optional), G3 (optional)
  • Microsoft Lumia: 1520, 1020, 930, 929, 928, 920
  • Google Nexus: 4, 5, 6, 7 (2013)
  • BlackBerry: Priv

If you don't see your phone, you likely need an adapter. Contact us for more information regarding adapters!

Would there be VAT or Import tax?

Due to the customs policy of different countries, we CANNOT control if there is tax for you. Our product price does NOT included VAT or import tax of your country.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

There will always be risks in any venture, but we have done our homework, so the risks are minimal. Before coming to Indiegogo, we have completed the product development and built several prototypes. We also established trusting relationships with our suppliers and teamed up with a global EMS company who is known for manufacturing for top companies.

story:
New member of Gravastar Family is available!

Dear friends,

Gravastar speakers were born to infuse creativity and craziness to the speaker market. Gravastar family has two members so far: big brother Mars, and little brother Venus. Put Mars and Venus together, they are the coolest scenery in your room. Mars was launched last year. It brings you the destroyer vibe when you first see it. Today we just launched Venus! Unlike the big brother Mars, Venus is very small, but it inherits the futuristic design and crazy bass.

Check Out the Venus and the new color of Mars!


 

THANK YOU ALL!

Gravastar is one of the most successful speaker campaigns in crowdfunding history. Without all your support, we cannot make it! Thanks again!

To celebrate our great success, we offer a limited discount of $199. We cannot offer this offer too long time, the price will increase to full retail soon. Don’t Regret it. Save big money today. Last chance discount offer! Wait any longer and you’ll completely miss out our best offers!

We have shipped out the first, second and third batch as promised. Now we are preparing the rest batch shipments! We will fulfill the perks according to the order sequences. 

Our campaign is not normal crowdfunding campaign, we are continuously shipping out Gravastar even our campaign is not end. The backers' encouragement comments are our best motivation!

Bring the Future To You  

GravaStar is more than just another Bluetooth speaker. We have reinvented how speakers are designed: tight, metal shell and sleek angles with built-in psychedelic lights, inspired by futuristic science fiction movies and games.   

The metal robot appearance doesn't just look cool, but its spherical body allows the sound waves to resonate, which enhances its audio on top of the tripod legs that forms its stable structure. With a weight of 1.6kg (3.53lbs), the GravaStar remains stable when playing music with heavy bass at high volume. 

You'll be able to enjoy the GravaStar for up to 30 hours on its battery, which gives you plenty of time to enjoy your music — no matter the time of day or night, both indoors and outdoors.  

Simply, the GravaStar provides you with a sensational experience through its powerful sound and deep bass. 

Immerse Yourself in Sound Waves 

The GravaStar has a diameter of 140mm (5.51in) and a radiator of 80mm (3.15in). Its large bass driver delivers full and powerful bass to your music and gaming experience.

In addition, the GravaStar uses a 70mm (2.76in), 20W full-range speaker. The natural spherical diaphragm reproduces clear mids and crisp highs for a clear and smooth sound up to 20KHz. The bass driver is made from a polyphenylene composite and a metal magnetic core to reproduce deeper drums and clearer vocals.

 

 

What Do the Professionals Think about GravaStar?

Top tech website Engadget has fully tested GravaStar and recommended it. Read more about the review here

Unboxing review from Larry Dickerson: "Look at this thing and you can see it is much much more than a simple speaker. LEDs are just the tip of the iceberg with how cool this speaker is, the over all look screams Sci-Fi and I love it..."

Top tech website The Next Web also reviewed GravaStar and recommended it. Read more about the review here

Professional music magazine MusicInterview has also tested GravaStar, and the musician reviewer just loves it! Read more about the review here

Top tech blog Craving Tech covers the latest updates in the technology industry and hands-on reviews on upcoming or current consumer products in the market. They tested GravaStar and highly recommended it. Read more about the review here

Unboxing review from SwiftKarateChop:"In this episode of Good Tech Cheap, Nick takes a look at the 50% OFF Sci-fi Alien Inspired Sphere Bluetooth Speaker by Gravastar currently on Indiegogo, and this speaker is awesome! Welcome to the future!

Unboxing review from Eazy Computer Solutions: "INSANE !! Bluetooth Speaker From The Future. Gravastar Crazy Cool of 2019 Amazing Sound !!!!"

The Story of GravaStar

This is not our first crowdfunding campaign. When we launched our Kickstarter campaign in October last year, we hit our goal in just 24 hours, raising $18,000 in just three days. However, we canceled our campaign at that time even though the Kickstarter campaign was a promising and successful campaign…

Why?

Our team seeks to provide the world's most innovative audio equipment. Our designers and engineers have worked in the audio industry for over 10 years. We have seen and made many regular boxy speakers. We believe this should be totally different from the audio community and we strongly believe this innovative speaker should be developed together by our team and the community! 

After our first pilot production in September 2018, we sent 20 samples to top audio experts, and attended the 100% Design London 2018 Exhibition to gather feedbacks! People loved our design a lot.

We are so grateful to the GravaStar community who provided helpful comments and suggestions to help our product development. Special thanks go to Didier Vilas, and Oh Yeon Joong for their help in developing our products！

The first version of GravaStar scored 9 out of 10. Some of our Gravastar community thought it was a pity to cancel the KS campaign, but we want a 100% perfect innovative speaker for our community! That's why we canceled our KS campaign and improved our products for another 6 months. 

Now we are 100% confident in the improved GravaStar design! We have sent out 200 review samples to top audio experts, gamers, and technologists, receiving all positive feedback! This is why we are confident to start mass production NOW! We will ship our first batch before the campaign ends. This time, GravaStar is not a general crowdfunding project. The GravaStar speaker is in its production stage so we will be ready to ship these to you very soon! The earlier you back our campaign, the sooner you will receive these very innovative speakers! No risk.  

We chose Indiegogo instead of Kickstarter because Indiegogo allows us to ship our product sooner – something that Kickstarter does not support. We don't want our fans to wait for several more months!

 
 

 

Futuristic Design Spherical Speaker

The sphere shape design provides the GravaStar a much clearer sound compared to other shapes we tried. Without any parallel walls or edges, the spherical shape greatly reduces any internal cabinet sound wave reflections and interference. Meanwhile, a spherical speaker allows soundwaves to transform all directions in the air so that listeners will be immersed in the sounds produced.

People like being different, and so does this Bluetooth speaker. The "alien" design with glowing lights makes the GravaStar appear like a creature from space, ready to come to life.

Technical Specifications 

 

We sent a production sample to the consumer electronics magazine Stuff.tv who really love our design and product. Read more on Stuff.tv

The Cross-Eyed Pianist is one of the UK’s leading blogs on classical music. The reviewer, Frances Wilson, blogs on music as The Cross-Eyed Pianist, is a UK top-tier pianist and musician who also loves and recommends the GravaStar speaker. Read more details here

Unboxing review from EBPMAN Tech Reviews :"Fantastic speaker with a unique look! Check it out!"
Unboxing review from Tech Steve: "Gravastar Futuristic Bluetooth 5.0 Speaker Simply Awesome!"

Deep in Sound 

Carefully engineered full-range and subwoofer drivers provide crystal clear and distortion-free sound. Rich bass is produced across all genres of music, from pop to jazz, to rock. With an extra Ti3118 amplifier chip, the power can be reached to 20W!

Its strong magnetic core easily recreates a natural-sounding human voice with enhanced bass for strong musical beats. 

Bluetooth 5.0

The GravaStar is equipped with the Qualcomm QCC3006 chip, with optimized features:  

  • Faster transfer speed
  • Further range 
  • Lower power consumption 

The speaker adopts Qualcomm's Bluetooth® wireless audio codec, improving its signal-to-noise ratio to minimize background noise. The listener will hear the tiniest of details in its music to provide realistic sound reproduced to sound like the musician’s live performance.

Super Easy Pairing

One press to pair with all devices including smartphones, laptops, tablets, and TVs.

 

30 Hours Battery Life 

You'll be able to use the GravaStar for up to 30 hours on its battery, which gives you plenty of time to enjoy your music all day, whether indoors or outdoors.   

 

USB-C Fast Charge with AUX Input

The GravaStar is charged via USB-C, with connectors and faster charging.

The GravaStar also features an AUX input, giving audio playback options to use a 3.5mm stereo audio cable, giving you a choice of audio sources when you use it.

 

1 GravaStar+ 1 GravaStar= Stereo Sound

GravaStar is equipped with Qualcomm's CRS Bluetooth chip with True Wireless Stereo (TWS), which means that the GravaStar can not only be used independently but also can be connected with a second speaker without an extra wire to give you stereo sound.

 

Shock-Absorbent Zinc Alloy Shell    

The main body of the GravaStar is made with a high-quality zinc alloy sphere that allows sound waves to resonate within its space. The metal legs at the base of its body form a highly stable structure which increases shock absorption. 

With a weight of 1.6kg (3.53lbs), the GravaStar is stable even when playing heavy bass at high volumes (without sacrificing its sound quality!)

The legs are easily folded for transportation and storage. 

Ambient Psychedelic Lighting

The mystical green glow makes GravaStar look like a space invader, giving you the feeling of a high-tech product built for the center of your party.

 

Home Concert At Your Fingertips

The touch-sensitive volume control on the top allows you to freely adjust its volume. 

 

Decorate Your Life with GravaStar

Are you tired of old boxy Bluetooth speakers and looking for a cool one? Imagine listening to music, enjoying movies, and watching sports with GravaStar. Its alien-look turns your room into a scene of your favorite sci-fi movie.       

 

Take GravaStar on Your Next Trip  

Wireless means freedom, so you can take your GravaStar everywhere. Take the GravaStar on your next trip and you'll see how it will be your best traveling buddy. 

Digital Journal, a technology and gadget magazine from 1998, has tested GravaStar speaker and given a thumbs up. Read more details on Digital Journal.

The Economic Times, which began publication in 1961, is the world's second-most widely read English-language business newspaper, tested the Gravastar and recommends it! Read more details on The Economic Times

Unboxing review from ThePapiGfunk :"The Coolest Speaker Ever!"

Unboxing review from EXCEL2TECH: "If you think you’re seeing a spider-like robot that could have come from a Syfy movie from outer space, you’re not going crazy. But what is CRAZY is the cool and ultimate sounding Bluetooth 5.0 Speaker created by ZOEAO. This speaker is called GravaStar and it has some awesome speakers. "

Timeline

 

How to Buy

Without all your support, we cannot make it! Thanks again!To celebrate our great success, we offer a limited discount of $199. We cannot offer this offer too long time, the price will increase to full retail soon. Don’t Regret it. Save big money today. Last chance discount offer! Wait any longer and you’ll completely miss out our best offers!We have shipped out the first, second and third batch as promised. Now we are preparing the rest batch shipments! We will fulfill the perks according to the order sequences. Our campaign is not normal crowdfunding campaign, we are continuously shipping out Gravastar even our campaign is not end. The backers' encouragement comments are our best motivation!Bring the Future To You  GravaStar is more than just another Bluetooth speaker. We have reinvented how speakers are designed: tight, metal shell and sleek angles with built-in psychedelic lights, inspired by futuristic science fiction movies and games.   The metal robot appearance doesn't just look cool, but its spherical body allows the sound waves to resonate, which enhances its audio on top of the tripod legs that forms its stable structure. With a weight of 1.6kg (3.53lbs), the GravaStar remains stable when playing music with heavy bass at high volume. You'll be able to enjoy the GravaStar for up to 30 hours on its battery, which gives you plenty of time to enjoy your music — no matter the time of day or night, both indoors and outdoors.  Simply, the GravaStar provides you with a sensational experience through its powerful sound and deep bass. Immerse Yourself in Sound Waves The GravaStar has a diameter of 140mm (5.51in) and a radiator of 80mm (3.15in). Its large bass driver delivers full and powerful bass to your music and gaming experience.In addition, the GravaStar uses a 70mm (2.76in), 20W full-range speaker. The natural spherical diaphragm reproduces clear mids and crisp highs for a clear and smooth sound up to 20KHz. The bass driver is made from a polyphenylene composite and a metal magnetic core to reproduce deeper drums and clearer vocals.
 

 What Do the Professionals Think about GravaStar?Top tech website Engadget has fully tested GravaStar and recommended it. Read more about the review hereUnboxing review from Larry Dickerson: "Look at this thing and you can see it is much much more than a simple speaker. LEDs are just the tip of the iceberg with how cool this speaker is, the over all look screams Sci-Fi and I love it..."Top tech website The Next Web also reviewed GravaStar and recommended it. Read more about the review hereProfessional music magazine MusicInterview has also tested GravaStar, and the musician reviewer just loves it! Read more about the review hereTop tech blog Craving Tech covers the latest updates in the technology industry and hands-on reviews on upcoming or current consumer products in the market. They tested GravaStar and highly recommended it. Read more about the review hereUnboxing review from SwiftKarateChop:"In this episode of Good Tech Cheap, Nick takes a look at the 50% OFF Sci-fi Alien Inspired Sphere Bluetooth Speaker by Gravastar currently on Indiegogo, and this speaker is awesome! Welcome to the future!


Unboxing review from Eazy Computer Solutions: "INSANE !! Bluetooth Speaker From The Future. Gravastar Crazy Cool of 2019 Amazing Sound !!!!"

The Story of GravaStar

This is not our first crowdfunding campaign. When we launched our Kickstarter campaign in October last year, we hit our goal in just 24 hours, raising $18,000 in just three days. However, we canceled our campaign at that time even though the Kickstarter campaign was a promising and successful campaign…
Why?
Our team seeks to provide the world's most innovative audio equipment. Our designers and engineers have worked in the audio industry for over 10 years. We have seen and made many regular boxy speakers. We believe this should be totally different from the audio community and we strongly believe this innovative speaker should be developed together by our team and the community! 
After our first pilot production in September 2018, we sent 20 samples to top audio experts, and attended the 100% Design London 2018 Exhibition to gather feedbacks! People loved our design a lot.

We are so grateful to the GravaStar community who provided helpful comments and suggestions to help our product development. Special thanks go to Didier Vilas, and Oh Yeon Joong for their help in developing our products！
The first version of GravaStar scored 9 out of 10. Some of our Gravastar community thought it was a pity to cancel the KS campaign, but we want a 100% perfect innovative speaker for our community! That's why we canceled our KS campaign and improved our products for another 6 months. 
Now we are 100% confident in the improved GravaStar design! We have sent out 200 review samples to top audio experts, gamers, and technologists, receiving all positive feedback! This is why we are confident to start mass production NOW! We will ship our first batch before the campaign ends. This time, GravaStar is not a general crowdfunding project. The GravaStar speaker is in its production stage so we will be ready to ship these to you very soon! The earlier you back our campaign, the sooner you will receive these very innovative speakers! No risk.  
We chose Indiegogo instead of Kickstarter because Indiegogo allows us to ship our product sooner – something that Kickstarter does not support. We don't want our fans to wait for several more months!
   Futuristic Design Spherical SpeakerThe sphere shape design provides the GravaStar a much clearer sound compared to other shapes we tried. Without any parallel walls or edges, the spherical shape greatly reduces any internal cabinet sound wave reflections and interference. Meanwhile, a spherical speaker allows soundwaves to transform all directions in the air so that listeners will be immersed in the sounds produced.People like being different, and so does this Bluetooth speaker. The "alien" design with glowing lights makes the GravaStar appear like a creature from space, ready to come to life.Technical Specifications  We sent a production sample to the consumer electronics magazine Stuff.tv who really love our design and product. Read more on Stuff.tvThe Cross-Eyed Pianist is one of the UK’s leading blogs on classical music. The reviewer, Frances Wilson, blogs on music as The Cross-Eyed Pianist, is a UK top-tier pianist and musician who also loves and recommends the GravaStar speaker. Read more details hereUnboxing review from EBPMAN Tech Reviews :"Fantastic speaker with a unique look! Check it out!"Unboxing review from Tech Steve: "Gravastar Futuristic Bluetooth 5.0 Speaker Simply Awesome!"Deep in Sound Carefully engineered full-range and subwoofer drivers provide crystal clear and distortion-free sound. Rich bass is produced across all genres of music, from pop to jazz, to rock. With an extra Ti3118 amplifier chip, the power can be reached to 20W!Its strong magnetic core easily recreates a natural-sounding human voice with enhanced bass for strong musical beats. Bluetooth 5.0The GravaStar is equipped with the Qualcomm QCC3006 chip, with optimized features:  
Faster transfer speed
Further range 
Lower power consumption 
The speaker adopts Qualcomm's Bluetooth® wireless audio codec, improving its signal-to-noise ratio to minimize background noise. The listener will hear the tiniest of details in its music to provide realistic sound reproduced to sound like the musician’s live performance.Super Easy PairingOne press to pair with all devices including smartphones, laptops, tablets, and TVs.

 
30 Hours Battery Life You'll be able to use the GravaStar for up to 30 hours on its battery, which gives you plenty of time to enjoy your music all day, whether indoors or outdoors.    USB-C Fast Charge with AUX InputThe GravaStar is charged via USB-C, with connectors and faster charging.The GravaStar also features an AUX input, giving audio playback options to use a 3.5mm stereo audio cable, giving you a choice of audio sources when you use it. 1 GravaStar+ 1 GravaStar= Stereo SoundGravaStar is equipped with Qualcomm's CRS Bluetooth chip with True Wireless Stereo (TWS), which means that the GravaStar can not only be used independently but also can be connected with a second speaker without an extra wire to give you stereo sound. Shock-Absorbent Zinc Alloy Shell    The main body of the GravaStar is made with a high-quality zinc alloy sphere that allows sound waves to resonate within its space. The metal legs at the base of its body form a highly stable structure which increases shock absorption. With a weight of 1.6kg (3.53lbs), the GravaStar is stable even when playing heavy bass at high volumes (without sacrificing its sound quality!)The legs are easily folded for transportation and storage. Ambient Psychedelic LightingThe mystical green glow makes GravaStar look like a space invader, giving you the feeling of a high-tech product built for the center of your party. Home Concert At Your FingertipsThe touch-sensitive volume control on the top allows you to freely adjust its volume.  Decorate Your Life with GravaStarAre you tired of old boxy Bluetooth speakers and looking for a cool one? Imagine listening to music, enjoying movies, and watching sports with GravaStar. Its alien-look turns your room into a scene of your favorite sci-fi movie.        Take GravaStar on Your Next Trip  Wireless means freedom, so you can take your GravaStar everywhere. Take the GravaStar on your next trip and you'll see how it will be your best traveling buddy. Digital Journal, a technology and gadget magazine from 1998, has tested GravaStar speaker and given a thumbs up. Read more details on Digital Journal.The Economic Times, which began publication in 1961, is the world's second-most widely read English-language business newspaper, tested the Gravastar and recommends it! Read more details on The Economic TimesUnboxing review from ThePapiGfunk :"The Coolest Speaker Ever!"
Unboxing review from EXCEL2TECH: "If you think you’re seeing a spider-like robot that could have come from a Syfy movie from outer space, you’re not going crazy. But what is CRAZY is the cool and ultimate sounding Bluetooth 5.0 Speaker created by ZOEAO. This speaker is called GravaStar and it has some awesome speakers. "Timeline How to Buy

story:
First Production Run:
 
 

        

            

Also reviewed in Best Tech and Gadgets 2017 video by YouTube tech influencer Arun Maini (500k+ subscribers, Channel: Mrwhosetheboss)  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3vCcQpyU4us

                       

                   

While you’re listening to headphones, you can be totally isolated from the world as you enjoy being immersed in your favorite music.

 BUT…this means you will miss hearing important outside sounds like:

  • A person trying to get your attention 
  • Someone at the door, package delivery
  • At work: announcements, phone calls, coworkers, the boss
  • At home: hearing family members or pets, something happening outside 
  • At the airport: announcements in the terminal or on the plane
  • Outdoors: driver alerting you, car honk
  • Unexpected events

            

                

SoundBrake listens to your surroundings and instantly streams in outside sounds ONLY when they're above an alert level, which adapts to your surroundings after a button press. Now you can be aware of sounds like a door knock, phone call, announcement, car honk, or someone trying to get your attention. You won't know SoundBrake is there while it's not alerting you. 

                                                 

Attach it to any headphones and audio player, such as a laptop, computer, smartphone, or tablet. Use it with Bluetooth headphones by connecting SoundBrake to a Bluetooth module. 

The world is unpredictable. Hear unexpected sounds.

 

   

      

 

This is what SoundBrake is like from your perspective:

 

That’s it! You’ll hear outside sounds streamed in when they’re louder than the alert level.

If you're using Bluetooth headphones, plug the Bluetooth transmitter module into SoundBrake instead of the headphone cord. Pair your headphones with the Bluetooth transmitter.

After you press a button, SoundBrake samples your surroundings, determines the loudest outside sound, and creates a custom alert level. It's easy to re-adjust at any time by just pressing the button again. 

Your headphones will instantly stream in outside sounds ONLY when they're louder than the custom alert level.

SoundBrake adds a layer of safety to outdoor activities such as hiking, cycling, or running. Don't miss out on hearing a car honking at you or someone shouting about an impending danger.

 

Trying SoundBrake 2.0 for the first time:

 

 

Reactions after trying SoundBrake 2.0:​

 

 

 

 

I'm Shari Eskenas, the founder of Sundae Electronics and inventor of SoundBrake. I thought of the idea for SoundBrake while I was working as an electrical engineer. The workplace had a no-headphones policy with the rationale that people could potentially be unaware of an emergency.

       

This is what inspired me to create SoundBrake...and that's how the journey began! I recognized the widespread problem of people being oblivious to their surroundings while listening to headphones. I designed the electronics and software, and teamed up with additional companies for product development and manufacturing. It has been over two years in the making. I'm very passionate about delivering a high quality product that will enhance your headphone experience. 

        

In early 2016, Sundae Electronics produced SoundBrake Generation 1.0 as the result of a successfully funded Kickstarter campaign. SoundBrake 1.0 instantly silenced your audio to alert you of outside sounds. In addition to the industrial design and LED indicators, the major improvement of SoundBrake 2.0 is that outside sound is instantly streamed into your headphones so you can clearly hear outside sound above the alert level.

 Funds from this project will be used for: 

                        

                              We can't wait to let all our supporters be the first to get it. 

Envy Creative (www.thinkenvy.com) did a great job with video production for our campaign video.  

Calpak USA (www.calpak-usa.com) is an engineering and manufacturing company that did excellent work on circuit board assembly for our prototypes.  

Scicon Technologies (www.scicontech.com) is a rapid prototype and manufacturing company that was able to do the high precision and high quality 3D printing that was required for the prototype enclosure parts.

 

Feel free to email us directly at hello@sundaelectronics.com or leave us a message if you have any questions or comments. We'd love to hear from you! 

Our website is http://www.sundaelectronics.com

Follow us!                  

           

Interested in writing about us and our mission? Download our press kit!

 

FAQ

1. How do I pre-order SoundBrake 2.0? 

On Mobile: Click on your desired Perk in the PERKS section. You will then see the pink "GET THIS PERK" button appear at the bottom of the Perk box you clicked. Click on this button to get to checkout. 

On Desktop/Tablet: Click on your desired Perk in the PERKS section on the right side of the campaign page. This will bring you to the checkout page. 

Please keep in mind during checkout:

  • You must enter your zip code in the credit card info section, or there will be a checkout error. 
  • Using auto-fill may cause a checkout error. 

2. How can I use SoundBrake with wireless headphones?

You can use SoundBrake with wireless headphones using a standalone wireless transmitter or Bluetooth transmitter module. Instead of plugging wired headphones into SoundBrake's audio jack, plug the wireless transmitter into the audio jack. Then pair your Bluetooth headphones with the transmitter. A Bluetooth transmitter module is included at a higher reward level.

3. How is this different than headphones with built-in ambient modes?

Headphones that have "ambient" or "transparency" modes to give you awareness of your surroundings let all outside sound pass through. This impacts your audio quality by removing your isolation and not allowing you to be fully immersed in your music. On the other hand, SoundBrake allows you to be fully isolated while still letting you clearly hear outside sounds louder than the alert level. 

Furthermore, when you use ambient mode headphones, your music can still distract you from hearing outside sounds, especially at higher volumes. On the other hand,  SoundBrake alerts you by streaming in outside sound while temporarily silencing your audio, so you can be aware of the outside sound and clearly hear it.

4. Is this different than using open air headphones?

Unlike open air headphones, SoundBrake will not let all outside sound pass through to your headphones. There is no impact to your headphone audio and you will only hear outside sound when it is louder than the alert level.

5. Will SoundBrake allow me to use my headphone's built-in controls?

Yes! SoundBrake has a four conductor audio plug, which allows it to be used with the headphone's built in track/volume controls.

6. What is SoundBrake's battery life?

The rechargeable battery lasts for 50+ hours on a single charge.

 

Note about International Shipping:  

International shipments may be subject to import taxes, customs duties, and fees levied by the destination country. We don't have control over these charges and you will be responsible for fulfilling them. When customs clearance procedures are required, it can cause a delay beyond our delivery estimate.

story:
"It's a simple thing, but it definitely helps keep the cord close to your body instead of dangling in front of you and flopping around while you do stuff. ... If you've ever gotten frustrated by a floppy earbud cord, this is a fast and easy fix. " - Rick Broida, CNET


WHAT?

The O!Snap Original Headphone Clip is an extraordinarily versatile headphone holder that traps your headphones where you want them and keeps your wires tangle-free. O!Snap fits most standard headphone wires, and utilizes two magnets strong enough to clamp to T-shirts, tank tops, sports bras and even sweatshirts! When finished with your workout (or pretending to workout), wrap your headphones neatly with the O!Snap and forget about the messy tangles. 

Colors include:

  • Graphite / Graphite
  • Deep Blue / Graphite
  • Light Gray / Bright White
  • Deep Green / Graphite
  • Deep Pink / Graphite

FUN FACT: Placing O!Snap on the same side as your microphone (if equipped) will keep the microphone angled directly in front of your mouth, allowing crystal clear voice calls no matter what you’re doing.

AIN'T NOBODY GOT TIME FOR THAT!

O!Snap isn’t just an incredible clip...It also doubles as a headphone management system by allowing neat coiling of headphone wires for storing, shuffling or mixing around in a messy drawer! Endless games of untying knots and making your blood boil is now a trouble of the past. O!Snap also uses a proprietary reflective polyurethane logo on the clip so that oncoming traffic can see you at night...Yes, we really have thought of everything!

When clipped to an article of clothing, O!Snap can be used for double headphone listening like when lifting weights or can offer mono-mode listening by holding one headphone while walking the streets.

O!Snap magnets allow you to attach headphones to your…

  • Fridge
  • Desk
  • Car
  • Gym locker
  • Light switch

...OR ANYWHERE!


HOW?

The wire-organizing O!Snap Original Headphone Clip uses specially designed magnets that don’t affect or interrupt your phone’s GPS signal, compass app, or even audio noise! This single piece exercise product will last for years since there aren’t any additional parts to lose...Plus, not even the toughest guy at the gym (no, not even the guy benching 4 plates on each side) can tear the Proprietary TPU Alloy used to produce the clips. Water, Rain or even the most careless person won’t destroy this clip.

PRODUCT SPECIFICATIONS:

Weight: 1 oz.

Height: 2 in. x 0.5 in. x 0.25 in.

WHO IS OREGON ACTIVE (ORA)?

O!Snap has teamed up with Oregon Active to give back. ORA is a 501(c)(3) non-profit  that is dedicated to providing Adventure Therapy to people with disabilities and other life challenging conditions. Through community support, positive emotion, and challenges, ORA helps people with disabilities or impairments discover abilities, values, passions and responsibilities in situations that only adventure can provide. As such, O!Snap has created a branded ORA O!Snap and is giving a percentage of proceeds to their cause. 


BRANDING?

The way we've designed this clip is to be easily brandable. Whether a Race, non-profit, or business, look no further for the next fun marketing piece your customers will love. This clip is so amazingly handy, your customers will keep thinking about your charity, event or business for years to come. Special White label opportunities even available for the right customers. 

RETAILERS!

If you are a small or mid-sized retailer looking for a great summer-time promotion or impulse buy, then this is the perfect opportunity for you. With small and medium retail packages available, we send you a box of our retail ready products, and even throw in a POP display for your storefront!

NON-PROFIT?

We love non-profits! So much that we give special perks just for you. Get a steal on a branded piece of merchandise to help support your cause. Give your customers a chance to keep remembering why they support your non-profit and a reason to give more! Select the right perk for your non-profit and let's start something together.

SCHOOLS!

Calling all high-schools & colleges! Support your school spirit by branding your school's mascot and slogan on an O!Snap. With retail ready products, we can have your school mascot on a clip in no time, ready to be sold at the student store or football game!

SHIPPING

After submitting your contribution, we will contact you with a link to pay additional shipping. This is best because we can bulk together multiple orders and send to you under one shipping cost instead of multiple. We will contact those that qualify for early shipping too!

International customers: It would be worth your shipping costs to buy more than one!!!

Estimated Shipping Costs

Sticker :: $Free  (US States) / $1 International

1-5 Clips :: $2 Domestic (US States) / $10 International

6-25 Clips :: $5 domestic (US States) / $20 international

26+ :: $15 domestic (US States) / $30 international

Custom Order/ Large Orders :: We will be contacting you directly

REVIEWS

http://thepalmettoqueen.blogspot.com/2013/08/osnap-convenience-for-headphone-wearers.html

http://www.livyupdater.com/2013/09/osnap-headphone-clip-review.html

http://libbyslibrary.com/2013/09/osnap-headphone-clip-review.html
